you have to be outrageously fed with a level advantage to do it. (or be dealing true damage)

on average a level 11 target has 1200+ hp, veigar himself squishy has 1212, you deal 230+60% and  250 - 500 +75-150% bonus ap.  you need well over 550ap to do it and your target to have 0 mr/health runes and for you to be dealing true damage. 

are you telling me you have even more than 550ap at 20minutes? how many kills do you have? if you throw in your targets liable 20% damage reduction from **just 15MR**, you need over 660AP.

Q will deal 740 damage with 800 AP, while ult will deal 925 WITHOUT taking R increased damaged for missing health into account. An average ADC has 1900 health at level 18 (even though by level 18 you will go way over 800 AP on Veigar, but w/e), as you can see Q+R will just fall short of killing that ADC, but if you take into account that Q essentially deleted almost half their health, and the really unnecessary TLD proc if you AA after casting ult (which you should, no reason not to) the ADC is dead, magic pen runes and Void Staff make their MR useless against this too.

theres a reason why you lose more games than win with veigar, its because hes simply a team dependent fighter. he needs be enabled and set up. you can not do it alone like old veigar. you are fundamentally playing him wrong.

Or maybe I just lose more games than win because I'm a Yasuo OTP so when I pick Veigar it is usually because Yasuo is banned and I can only play Yasuo at a Diamond level? It has nothing to do with Veigar being bad, I'm just not good enough.

Once in a blue moon, when I mistakenly take AD runes with Veigar, I find it fitting to build {{item:3146}} on him. If you haven't tried it as a joke yet, I highly suggest it. It gives a nice 80 AP and 250+30% instantaneous point and click damage to your burst.

That brings the full combo without considering meteor strike to be 730 - 980 + 165% - 240% at level 11 (if CrestKnight's numbers are correct). and it includes a slow. Not to mention since all these numbers are on single target burst damage, you heal for 33% of the damage dealt.

In any case, I think the conversation went off on a tangent that could be easily explained away. If Veigar misses his cage, and therefore can't hit meteor (even though he often can anyway), people might be able to escape his burst. If you miss the Q, then his R no longer 1-shots mages so you might be in trouble. However, if Yasuo dives in and misses his knockup, he ALSO can't instantly murder people. If we're going analyze a mage designed to kill champions by first assuming that he misses two of his basic moves, then what's the point? That's the same as saying a Lee Sin can't use his Q or E in ganks. He won't kill anyone either.

**TL;DR If you miss cage and meteor, then it sucks to be you. That doesn't mean Veigar is weak, that just means you fucked up the combo.**

people that theorycraft like this (Veigar is useless because he misses his W) don't understand the point of theorycrafting. You don't get to assume you hit all your spells/the enemy misses all their spells when you theorycraft...

I don't see the point of TLD really. It adds burst onto a combo that can already do 100-200% of their health. I prefer DFT because it adds a bonus 10% AP ratio on all of his spells, instead of just his combo. Makes his poke a lot more dangerous.

I mainly take TLD because flat magic pen is way better than the % magic pen in ferocity tree. Also adds kill pressure earlier in the game. But yeah, DFT is way better late game since you won't need TLD.
